content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic head medullary carcinoma

Management:		15 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:		pT3N0M0 medullary carcinoma, MMR deficient on immunohistochemistry

Current situation:	Routine surveillance follow-up

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up following completion of adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy in June 2024. She has recovered well from treatment with improving energy levels and has regained 3kg weight. Her main ongoing issue is mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her feet, which is gradually improving. Current weight is 68kg and performance status is 0. Clinical examination shows well-healed surgical scars with no concerning features. Recent surveillance CT scan on 15/7/24 shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests including CA19-9 are within normal range. The plan is to continue 3-monthly surveillance with next CT scan due in October 2024. She will be reviewed again following those results.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: mild peripheral neuropathy affecting feet, gradually improving
well-healed surgical scars with no concerning features
blood tests including CA19-9 within normal range

status_updates.value: Post-operative pancreatic cancer patient completed adjuvant chemotherapy. Currently well with no evidence of recurrence on surveillance.
residual mild peripheral neuropathy from chemotherapy, gradually improving
improving energy levels and weight gain of 3kg
